Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G2 Condition of heritage features including designated geological sites and scheduled monuments
To Indicator: D2 Extent and condition of protected sites – land, water and sea
Rationale: Geological sites are a subset of protected areas.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G3 Enhancement of green/blue infrastructure
To Indicator: D1 Quantity, quality and connectivity of habitats
Rationale: Accessible natural greenspaces have an important contribution to make to the quality of the environment in urban areas. Such sites provide important refuges for wildlife in otherwise impoverished areas.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G3 Enhancement of green/blue infrastructure
Rationale: Green and blue spaces and features in and around our built environment, including within Green Belts, are essential to health and well-being.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G4 Engagement in the natural environment
Rationale: G7 shows that most people agree that spending time outdoors is important for their physical and mental health.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G5 People engaged in social action for the environment
To Indicator: D2 Extent and condition of protected sites – land, water and sea
Rationale: G5 includes data on volunteer hours from organisations that manage protected areas such as the Wildlife Trusts.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G6 Environmental attitudes and behaviours
Rationale: G6 will include information on people’s self-reported environmental behaviours, likely including questions on water use.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G6 Environmental attitudes and behaviours
Rationale: G6 will include information on people’s self-reported environmental behaviours, likely including questions on waste.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: G6 Environmental attitudes and behaviours
To Indicator: J1 Carbon footprint and consumer buying choices
Rationale: G6 will include information on people’s self-reported environmental behaviours, likely including questions on behaviours related to carbon use.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: A3 Concentrations of fine particulate matter (PM2.5) in the air
Rationale: Long-term exposure to particulate matter contributes to the risk of developing cardiovascular disease and lung cancer.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: A4 Rural background concentrations of ozone (O3)
Rationale: Ozone is a gas which is damaging to human health and can trigger inflammation of the respiratory tract, eyes, nose and throat as well as asthma attacks.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: A5 Roadside nitrogen dioxide (NO2) concentrations
Rationale: Short-term exposure to concentrations of NO2 can cause inflammation of the airways and increase susceptibility to respiratory infections and to allergens. NO2 can exacerbate the symptoms of those already suffering from lung or heart conditions.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: A6 Exceedance of damaging levels of nutrient nitrogen deposition on ecosystems
To Indicator: G1 Changes in landscape and waterscape character
Rationale: Nutrient nitrogen deposition affects the nutrient levels and diversity of species in sensitive environments, for example, by encouraging algae growth in lakes and water courses.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: B2 Serious pollution incidents to water
Rationale: The 2 higher categories of serious pollution event cause, for example, potential harm to bathers.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: B4 Condition of bathing waters
Rationale: Status of bathing waters is based on a set of microbiological tests (measuring E.coli and intestinal enterococci) performed on waters used for bathing. The bacteria, if present, can cause severe stomach upsets and gastro-intestinal illness.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: D2 Extent and condition of protected sites – land, water and sea
To Indicator: G1 Changes in landscape and waterscape character
Rationale: Changes in environmental outcomes from our Designated Landscapes will be considered as part of the G1 indicator.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: D3 Area of woodland in England
To Indicator: G1 Changes in landscape and waterscape character
Rationale: G1 will consider attributes of landscape such as woodland cover.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: D3 Area of woodland in England
Rationale: Woodland will be included in metrics of green infrastructure.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: D3 Area of woodland in England
To Indicator: G4 Engagement in the natural environment
Rationale: Some visits to the natural environment will be visits to woodland.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: H3 Emissions of mercury and persistent organic pollutants to the environment
Rationale: POPs are chemicals that remain intact in the environment for long periods, become widely distributed geographically, accumulate in the tissues of humans and wildlife, and have harmful impacts on human health or on the environment. Mercury is toxic and can cause damage to human health and accumulates in the environment and the food chain.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: H5 Exposure to transport noise
Rationale: Health costs (and hence burden to the economy) of noise can be estimated from health outcomes associated with noise exposure (such as annoyance, sleep disturbance, and cardiovascular effects).

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: J5 Prevent harmful chemicals from being recycled
Rationale: Chemicals measured in J5 include POPs which can bioaccumulate and have harmful impacts on health.

Primary goal: Enhancing beauty, heritage and engagement with the natural environment
From Indicator: J6 Waste crime
To Indicator: G1 Changes in landscape and waterscape character
Rationale: Fly tipping will influence changes in the public’s perceptions of landscape character and quality, which will become part of the G1 indicator.
